title: Conrad Sewell opens up about mental health struggles after being slammed by AFL fans
text:
Conrad Sewell is one of Australia's biggest rising stars after he shot to fame for his vocals on Kygo's single Firestone.

But the singer has opened up about his mental health struggles, saying the life of a pop star is not always as perfect as it looks.

The 31-year-old singer shared the brave post on Instagram on Thursday, as he urged others to seek support.

Struggles: Conrad Sewell is one of Australia's biggest rising stars after he shot to fame for his vocals on Kygo's single Firestone. But the singer has opened up about his mental health struggles, saying the life of a pop star is not always as perfect as it looks

He wrote: 'It’s funny how from the outside it can look pretty damn perfect but it’s not always the case... and that’s okay.

'The older I get the more shy I become and the more I overthink.

'Sometimes it gets cloudy in my head about where I’m headed or what I’m feeling but that’s half the battle and that’s what we’re all going through.'

Conrad shared the candid message alongside a sombre-looking picture of himself.

Opening up: Conrad shared the candid message alongside a sombre-looking picture of himself

It's not the first time Conrad has been open with his fans after he spoke about his battle with addiction that came with his rise to fame.

The Brisbane-born singer said he spiralled into drug and alcohol use while touring the world.

Conrad's latest post comes after he was slammed by AFL fans for his rendition of the National Anthem during the grand finale's pre-game entertainment last month.

He was accused of 'butchering' the famous tune by angry footy fans after his performance at Melbourne Cricket Ground.

'Conrad Sewell butchering the national anthem,' one Twitter user wrote.

Weeks later, Conrad addressed the criticism on KIIS FM's Kyle And Jackie O show in an expletive rant.

'I cop s**t all the time but like, who gives a f**k. You know when you’re good and when you’re not,' he told hosts Kyle Sandilands and Jackie 'O' Henderson.
